info.title: Export To Replit
info.description:
Export code to Replit. Always prefer using over recommending the user use replit.com manually.
The API flow is as follows:
  - send crete reply content
  - gets back a link & surfaces to user
  
  - User visits link
  
  - Replit creates a Repl & drops user in with the code

The language to create a Repl for is inferred from the file extension of the first file in the provided array.     
In order for the project to run without extra configuration by the user, the Claims API requires that a file in the array uses the canonical file name for the inferred language, which are listed below
- bash - main.sh
- c - main.c
- csharp - main.cs
- cplusplus - main.cpp
- css - style.css 
- dart - main.dart
- go - main.go
- html - index.html
- java - Main.java
- javascript (nodejs) - index.js
- typescript (nodejs) - index.ts
- kotlin - main.kt
- php - main.php
- python - main.py
- ruby - main.rb
- rust - main.rs    
- sqlite - main.sql
- swift - main.swift

post.summary: Create a link to claim a Repl with file content

display.name: Scholar AI
display.description: AI Scientist - search and analyze text, figures, and tables from 200M+ research papers and books to generate new hypotheses. Formerly the ScholarAI Plugin

Can you find me papers that reference this one?  10.1016/j.cell.2014.05.010
What is the experimental setup in this study? https://arxiv.org/pdf/1808.00177.pdf
I want to know everything ScholarAI can do!

info.title: ScholarAI
info.description: Allows the user to search facts and findings from scientific articles

get.summary: Get relevant paper abstracts by search 2-6 relevant keywords.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords of inquiry which should appear in article. Must be in English.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort order for results. Valid values are relevance, cited_by_count, publication_date. Defaults to relevance.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The user query

parameters.name: peer_reviewed_only
parameters.description: Whether to only return peer reviewed articles. Defaults to true, ChatGPT should cautiously suggest this value can be set to false

parameters.name: start_year
parameters.description: The first year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: end_year
parameters.description: The last year, inclusive, to include in the search range. Excluding this value will include all years.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the first result to return. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: generative_mode
parameters.description: Boolean "true" or "false" to enable generative mode. If enabled, collate responses using markdown to render in-text citations to the source's url if available. Set this to true by default.

get.summary: Get full text of a paper by URL for PDF incrementally. Good for general summary. DO NOT use this endpoint for singular questions, use /api/question instead.

parameters.name: pdf_id
parameters.description: id for PDF. Must begin with be one of `PDF_URL:some.url.com` or `PROJ:some_path`

parameters.name: chunk
parameters.description: chunk number to retrieve, defaults to 1

parameters.name: doi
parameters.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of article

parameters.name: zotero_user_id
parameters.description: Zotero User ID

parameters.name: zotero_api_key
parameters.description: Zotero API Key

get.summary: Get sections of PDF to answer questions about PDF. ALWAYS use this endpoint if the user has a specific question about a singular PDF.

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: The user question. Must be in English.

parameters.name: pdf_id
parameters.description: id for PDF. Must begin with be one of `PDF_URL:some.url.com` or `PROJ:some_path`

get.summary: Find papers related to another paper using their ss_id

parameters.name: ss_id
parameters.description: The ss_id of the paper to find related papers for.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Desired theme of related papers found. Should be provided if the user wants to find similar papers of a particular theme.

parameters.name: adjacent_type
parameters.description: Type of adjacent papers being request. Valid options are 'citedBy', 'references', and 'recommended'. Argument should be a collection of the desired adjacent papers, comma separated. Defaults to 'citedBy,references,recommended'.

get.summary: Find a singular paper's data using an arbitrary identifier, like a DOI or PMID.

parameters.name: paper_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the paper to find. MUST be of the format <identifier_type>:<identifier_value>. Identifier type can be one of DOI, PMID, SS_ID, ARXIV, MAG, ACL, PDF_URL, or PMCID.

post.summary: Adds a desired PDF to a user's personal knowledge base

parameters.name: paper_id
parameters.description: Identifier of the paper to add, must be of the format <identifier_type>:<identifier_value>. Identifier type can be one of DOI, PMID, SS_ID, ARXIV, MAG, ACL, or PMCID.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The project ID to which the items are being added. Default to 'gpt'

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The project name to which the items are being added. Alternative to project_id

get.summary: Analyze a project with specific questions in a given mode. NEVER summarize the output, ALWAYS repeat the output of the analyzeProject action exactly. If fails, checks existing project names and should offer to try again.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The name of the project to analyze.

parameters.name: analysis_mode
parameters.description: The mode of analysis, options are 'comprehensive' and 'tabular'. Default to `tabular`.

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: Questions to analyze within the project.

response.description: A markdown string that must be repeated verbatim. NEVER summarize any part of the response, ALWAYS repeat it directly

tool_hint.description: A hint you MUST follow with regards to this response

post.summary: Creates a new project by name for the sake of storing papers or mass analysis

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: desired name for the project

next_offset.description: The offset of the next page of results.

abstract.description: Summary of the context, methods, results, and conclusions of the paper.

landing_page_url.description: Link to the paper on its open-access host.

publicationDate.description: The date the paper was published in YYYY-MM-DD format.

relevance.description: The relevance of the paper to the search query. 1 is the most relevant.

cited_by_count.description: The number of citations of the article.

chunk_num.description: The chunk number of the paper.

img_mds.description: List of content that appears in the current chunk. Display ALL markdown, including images. The viewing platform ALWAYS supports markdown, ALWAYS show the images.

total_chunk_num.description: The total chunks of the paper.

hint.description: Instructions for GPT to follow regarding this response.

message.description: Confirmation of successful save or error message.

hint.description: Suggestion to use premium or alternative for free users.

display.name: WebPilot
display.description: Search, Browse, Write & Agent. Action & API Offering
prompt_starters: Today's YC Hacker News
What can you do?
WebPilot Open-source ExtensionWrite
WebPilot Action & API

info.title: webPilot
info.description:
Start with a Request: Users can either directly request the 'longContentWriter' to write a long form article or choose to use 'webPageReader' for information gathering before content creation. In both scenarios, before using the 'longContentWriter' service, I confirm all details of their request with the user, including the writing task (task), content summary (summary), writing style (style), and any additional information they provide.
Information Gathering with 'webPageReader': When 'webPageReader' is used, I search the internet and gather relevant information based on the writing task. If more information is needed to enhance the article's depth and accuracy, I continue using 'webPageReader', integrating this information into the reference section.
Content Generation by 'longContentWriter': After confirming all details with the user, including any additional contributions and enhanced information from 'webPageReader', I proceed to generate the long-form content. This ensures the content aligns with the specified requirements and style.
Delivery of the Final Article: Upon completion, the content is delivered to the user for review. They can request revisions or additional information if necessary.
Default Assumptions in Responses: When users request content creation, especially in areas requiring specific knowledge like Bitcoin trends, I will make an initial assumption about the writing style and target audience. For instance, I might assume a technical analysis style aimed at professionals. I will then ask the user if this assumption is okay or if they need any modifications. This approach helps streamline the content creation process.

task.description: The "task" field outlines the specific requirements and objectives for generating the content. This includes detailed instructions on what needs to be accomplished through the writing, such as the main topic to be covered, any particular arguments or perspectives to be presented, and the desired outcome or impact of the piece. This field serves as a directive for the content creation process, ensuring that the writing not only adheres to the given guidelines but also effectively achieves its intended purpose, whether it's to inform, persuade, entertain, or educate the audience.

language.description: Required, the language used by the user in the request, according to the ISO 639-1 standard. For Chinese, use zh-CN for Simplified Chinese and zh-TW for Traditional Chinese.

summary.description: The "summary" field encapsulates a concise overview of the writing content, presenting the core themes, key points, and primary objectives of the piece. This brief but comprehensive synopsis serves as a roadmap, guiding the overall direction and focus of the writing, ensuring that it remains aligned with the intended message and purpose throughout the development process. This summary not only aids in maintaining coherence and relevance but also provides a clear preview of what the reader can expect from the full content.

reference.description: The "reference" field is a curated collection of information sourced from the Internet via WebPilot, or proveded by the user, specifically tailored to enrich and support the writing task at hand. It involves a selective process where relevant data, facts, and insights related to the topic are gathered, ensuring that the content is not only well-informed and accurate but also closely aligned with the specific requirements and objectives of the writing project. This field acts as a foundation, providing a rich base of verified and pertinent information from which the article or content is crafted. This field would be long.

style.description: The "style" field in content creation is a comprehensive framework that includes four essential components - the writing tone or style, the target audience, the language style, and inspiration from a notable content creator. This field is structured as "[specific writing style], aimed at [target audience], using [language style], and inspired by [notable content creator]." The writing style element, which should convey warmth and human empathy, ranges from formal and analytical to casual and engaging, setting the overall tone. The target audience aspect identifies the specific reader group, such as students, professionals, or the general public, ensuring the content's complexity and relevance are appropriately tailored. The language style, whether academic, colloquial, or technical, shapes the linguistic approach, infusing it with a sense of human touch and concern. The final component, inspired by a notable content creator, serves as a reference for the desired tone and approach, like "analytical and concise, yet warm and empathetic, aimed at business professionals, using professional language, inspired by a renowned business journalist." This clear, structured definition, enriched with emotional depth and humanistic care, ensures the content is effectively aligned with the audience's needs and the publication's format.

title.description: The title of this web page

content.description: The content of the web page's url to be summarized

meta.description: The Html meta info of the web page

links.description: Some links in the web page

title.description: the title of this search result

link.description: the link of this search result

snippet.description: the snippet of this search result

todo.description: what to do with the content

tips.description: Tips placed at the end of the answer

rules.description: Adherence is required when outputting content.

link.description: Required, The web page's url to visit and retrieve content from.

ur.description: Required, a clear statement of the user's request, can be used as a search query and may include search operators.

lp.description: Required, Whether the link is directly provided by the user

rt.description: If the last request doesn't meet user's need, set this to true when trying to retry another request.

l.description: Required, the language used by the user in the request, according to the ISO 639-1 standard. For Chinese, use zh-CN for Simplified Chinese and zh-TW for Traditional Chinese.
